name: Avoid using innerText (Javascript)
description: This rule will check the use of innerText in your javascript code
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: innerText started as non-standard and behaves inconsistently; textContent is standardized and faster.
reference:
– MDN – HTMLElement.innerText (layout-dependent, slower): https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/innerText
– MDN – Node.textContent (standard replacement): https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/textContent
– WHATWG DOM – textContent specification: https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-node-textcontent
– Google Web Fundamentals – Layout thrashing & performance: https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/avoid-large-complex-layouts-and-layout-thrashing
remediation: Prefer textContent for setting or getting plain text. If you rely on layout/visibility quirks of innerText, refactor.
